instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-08)Stuck in Apple Logo
threads.message:
Hello Jhon here Again, I have macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> it has Complete Power Rails but cannot proceed to turn on.If i will remove the SSD the screen show (?) question mark. I also try to boot my bootable drive but the same cannot proceed to boot up. I did SMC reset and the same issue. I notice sometimes its shuting down  automatically during booting time when apple logo show up.

What is the possible issue of this macbook please help me. Please see the pic attached,

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-08)Stuck in Apple Logo
threads.message:
You cannot enter macOS botting through USB?
In such case, you should discard a BIOS issue.
Clean your ME region, or try full known good BIOS file; with clean ME, of course.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-08)Stuck in Apple Logo
threads.message: I was able to enter the boot menu but after few seconds its shuting down only once. But now I cannot enter to boot menu. Maybe you have good bios file sir I never have any here.
